DataElement.preferredName: Terminal Deoxyribonucleotidyl Transferase Antigen Assay Antibody Source Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a text field to provide the source of an antibody used to detect the presence of the DNA polymerase terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TdT) antigen expressed on leukemic white blood cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Terminal Deoxyribonucleotidyl Transferase Antigen assay Antibody Source
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the source of the protein (antibody) used to detect the presence of the DNA polymerase terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase antigen expressed on leukemic white blood cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Terminal deoxynucleotidyltransferase is a unique DNA polymerase that without template direction catalyzes the addition of deoxyribonucleotides onto the 3-prime-hydroxyl end of DNA primers. TDT catalyzes the insertion of nucleotides (N regions) at the V(H)-D and D-J(H) junctions of immunoglobulin genes. The enzyme is present in immature thymocytes, some bone marrow cells, transformed pre-B and pre-T cell lines, and leukemia cells.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: DNA nucleotidylexotransferase (509 aa, ~59 kDa) is encoded by the human DNTT gene. This protein plays a role in DNA polymerization and specifically catalyzes the insertion of nucleotides (N regions) at the V(H)-D and D-J(H) junctions of immunoglobulin genes.

Property.preferredDefinition: (AN-tih-BOD-ee) A type of protein made by certain white blood cells in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody can bind to only a specific antigen. The purpose of this binding is to help destroy the antigen. Antibodies can work in several ways, depending on the nature of the antigen. Some antibodies destroy antigens directly. Others make it easier for white blood cells to destroy the antigen.:Source; where something is available.

Concepts.definition: A type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a text field to provide attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
